boofcv.alg.feature.detect.extract
Interface NonMaxExtractor

All Known Implementing Classes:
FastNonMaxExtractor, NonMaxExtractorNaive
public interface NonMaxExtractor

Extracts features from the intensity image by finding local maximums. Previously found corners are automatically excluded and not added again. Features below an intensity threshold are automatically ignored and no two features can be closer than the minSeparation apart.

Strict versus Not Strict. Standard non-maximum suppression requires that the central point be a true maximum. There are situations where symmetry in the image causes a couple of local pixels to have the exact same value and what happens is that no points are found in those situations. In these situations it might be appropriate use the not strict rule which just requires that no local pixel have a higher value.

strict: I(x_c,y_x) > I(x,y) for all (x,y) around (x_c,y_c)
not struct: I(x_c,y_x) >= I(x,y) for all (x,y) around (x_c,y_c)

Author:
Peter Abeles

Method Detail

setMinSeparation

void setMinSeparation(int minSeparation)
Sets the minimum distance two features can be. This is the local region which is searched in non-max suppression.

Parameters:
minSeparation - How close two features can be.

setThresh

void setThresh(float thresh)
The minimum intensity a feature can have.

Parameters:
thresh - Minimum intensity a feature can have to be valid.

setInputBorder

void setInputBorder(int border)
Specifies the size of the input image border which is ignored.

Parameters:
border - Size of image border.

getInputBorder

int getInputBorder()

isStrict

boolean isStrict()
Does it use the strict non-max rule or not?

Returns:
true if strict.

getThresh

float getThresh()
Returns the current feature selection threshold.

process

void process(ImageFloat32 intensityImage,
             QueueCorner corners)
Detects corners in the image. If a pixel has an intensity less than the minimum threshold or has a value equal to Float.MAX_VALUE it cannot be an image feature. Typically Float.MAX_VALUE is given to features which have already been detected and should not be returned again.

Parameters:
intensityImage - Feature intensity image. Can be modified.
corners - Where found corners are stored.
